qas.question: Name the two women present with Mary at the Crucifixion of Jesus?

answers.text: Mary of Clopas and Mary Magdalene

qas.question: In art, what is the name for the motif of Mary cradling the body of Jesus?
In Matthew, who else besides Mary of Clopas and Mary Magdalene are with Mary at the Crucifixion?
What is a representation of Mary at the Crucifixion called?
What is the name for the motif of Jesus cradling the body of Mary?
Who is "the disciple whom Jesus loved"?
What is a representation of Jesus at the Crucifixion called?
Who was the sister of Mary of Clopas?

context: Mary is also depicted as being present among the women at the crucifixion during the crucifixion standing near "the disciple whom Jesus loved" along with <a0_0>Mary of Clopas and <b8_0>Mary Magdalene<b8_0/><a0_0/>,[Jn 19:25-26] to which list Matthew 27:56 adds "the mother of the sons of <b6_0>Zebedee<b6_0/>", presumably the <a2_0>Salome<a2_0/> mentioned in Mark 15:40. This representation is called <a4_0>a <b7_0>Stabat Mater<b7_0/><a4_0/>. While not recorded in the Gospel accounts, Mary cradling the dead body of her son is a common motif in art, called a "<a1_0><b5_0>pietà<b5_0/><a1_0/>" or "<a3_0>pity<a3_0/>".
